TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PackageDigitalSignature extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a digital signature that is applied to a set of package parts and relationships.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A PackageDigitalSignature object is immutable and cannot be altered after it is created.
For security, a PackageDigitalSignature can be associated with parts within a <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>. A PackageDigitalSignature incorporates an X.509 certificate that provides two features:
- Identifies and authenticates the originator of the part.
- Validates that the part has not been modified.
The digital signature does not preclude a part from being modified, but a validation check against the signature fails if the part has changed in any way. The application can then take appropriate actionâ€”for example, it can prevent the part from opening or it can notify the user that the part has been modified and is not secure.
For more information about package digital signatures, see the MSDN article [Digital Signing Framework of the Open Packaging Conventions](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=74494).

Docs.summary: Gets the X.509 certificate embedding option.
Docs.value: One of the values that specifies the option for the digital signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks X.509 certificates used to validate a package may be stored in one of three locations: ||| |-|-| ||In its own certificate in the package.

The X.509 certificate can be obtained through the property.| ||Within the content of the in the package.

The X.509 certificate can be obtained through the property.| ||External to the package in a location known by both the application that creates the signature and the application that later uses the signature for validation.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<string> GetPartTransformList(class System.Uri partName) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Uri> of the to return the transform list for.
Docs.summary: Returns an ordered list of the operations applied to a given part.
Docs.returns: An ordered list of URI strings, such as or , that represents the canonical XML transformations applied to the part with the given URI.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML digital signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Signature provides access to the foundation class that performs type-specific signature cryptographic functions and serialization to and from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart> that hosts the signature.

Docs.exception: The digital Signature has been deleted.

Docs.summary: Gets the that contains the signature.
Docs.value: The package part that contains the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The signature's package part is frequently accessed when the signature is countersigned.

Docs.summary: Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] string that identifies the signature type.
Docs.value: A [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] string that identifies the signature type. The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the encrypted hash value of the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.Signature%2A>.
Docs.value: A byte array that contains the encrypted hash value of the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.Signature%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all the objects signed with the signature.
Docs.value: A collection that contains all the package parts signed with the signature.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of the parts that have been signed with the signature.
Docs.value: The list of the parts that have been signed with the signature.

Docs.summary: Gets the X.509 certificate of the signer.
Docs.value: The digital certificate of the signer, or if the certificate is not stored in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Signer returns the X.509 certificate of the signer when the digital certificate is stored within the package (that is, when <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.CertificateEmbeddingOption%2A> is <xref:System.IO.Packaging.CertificateEmbeddingOption> or <xref:System.IO.Packaging.CertificateEmbeddingOption>).
Signer returns `null` when the X.509 certificate is not stored in the package (that is, when <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.CertificateEmbeddingOption%2A> is <xref:System.IO.Packaging.CertificateEmbeddingOption>).

Docs.summary: Gets the date and time that the signature was created.
Docs.value: The date and time that the signature was created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.TimeFormat%2A> property specifies the format of the date. The format of the SigningTime string is based on the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignatureManager.TimeFormat%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property in effect when the signature was created.
SigningTime is based on the system time of the computer where the signing took place.
SigningTime is not a "secure TimeStamp" and is not from trusted Time Stamp Authority. A secure TimeStamp must be obtained and applied through a trusted Time Stamp Authority.

Docs.summary: Gets the format of the date and time returned by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.SigningTime%2A> property.
Docs.value: The format of the date and time returned by the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature.SigningTime%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Date/time formats follow the syntax of the W3C [Date and Time Formats](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=84446) note. The components shown in the following table must use the syntax and punctuation shown.
|TimeFormat|Description|Example| |----------------|-----------------|-------------| |YYYY|Year|2005| |YYYY-MM|Year and month|2005-07| |YYYY-MM-DD|Complete date|2005-07-28| |YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD|Complete date plus hours and minutes|2005-07-28T19:20-01:00| |YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD|Complete date plus hours, minutes, and seconds|2005-07-28T19:20:45-01:00| |YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD|Complete date plus hours, minutes, and seconds with a decimal fraction|2005-07-28T19:20:45.75-01:00|
where:
||| |-|-| |YYYY|four-digit year (for example 2006)| |MM|two-digit month (01=January)| |DD|two-digit day of month (01 through 31)| |Thh|two-digit hour (00 through 23, 24-hour time)| |mm|two digits of minutes (00 through 59)| |ss|two digits of seconds (00 through 59)| |s|one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second| |TZD|time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult Verify() cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies the digital signature against an X.509 certificate.
Docs.returns: if the verification succeeded; otherwise, one of the values that identifies a problem.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method verifies the signature against an embedded X.509 certificate stored in the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult Verify(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate signingCertificate) cil managed

Docs.param: The signer's X.509 certificate to verify the digital signature against.
Docs.summary: Verifies the digital signature against a given X.509 certificate.
Docs.returns: if the verification succeeded; otherwise, one of the values that identifies a problem.
